content: @Damiano Testa has done a great job splitting the monster liouville PR into pieces. If anyone wants to help generalize and move some of the smaller lemmas in this PR to their proper places, please come and help!

After Johan's moral support and suggestions, I extracted 3 very short PRs with lemmas scattered throughout mathlib. If anyone wants to take a look, I would be very grateful!

  • #8021: an inequality involving 2.
  • #8022: three monotonicity lemmas.
  • #8023: the summability of a series.

Dear All,

here is an update on the status of the Liouville PRs:

  • #8001 proves two inequalities
  • #8005 develops some API for Liouville numbers
  • #8020 uses the results from the previous two PRs to finish the proof!

Note: #8001 and #8005 are independent of one another. Each one of them is quite short (well under 100 lines).

Dear All,

the final Liouville PR merged: now mathlib knows that Liouville's constant is transcendental!

Thank you very much for all your help! In case you have not followed this from the beginning, I wanted to highlight that the bulk of the proof was written by Jujian Zhang: my contribution has been to take over a working proof and dissecting it into mathlib.

One final PR: #8068 for getting Liouville's theorem on the overview!

Thanks again!
Amazing! Congratulations to both of you! Did you update our overview files?
#8086 is the PR updating the overview file and Anne suggested updating also the undergrad one!
Why did you put this in the analysis section?
We have a number theory section there.
Ok, if you prefer number theory, I am happy with that. I had managed to convince Johan that it was not algebra, but he had not tried number theory!
I just changed it to number theory.
(Every time that I label a PR easy, it takes way longer than 20 seconds...)
A PR is still easy if a reviewer can say "no this is wrong" in less than 20 seconds, right?
Eric, thank you for your comforting words: I am now convinced that every time that I labeled a PR easy, I did it correctly!

Eric Wieser said:

A PR is still easy if a reviewer can say "no this is wrong" in less than 20 seconds, right?

So can I tag all my PRs with easy then?
Do we want the Lean files under number_theory/ as well? The liouville/ folder is currently under analysis/ as well. (I don't know enough about this area of math to have an opinion on this.)
Ooh, I did not pay attention to that during the reviews. Yes, I think moving everything to number_theory makes sense.
At some point we'll have analytic_number_theory/ (-;

Most of the PRs that led to the final proof were about summing series, inequalities and density. For this reason, I had thought of putting it in analysis. I personally do not find splitting maths into subjects something particularly well-defined so I do not mind about where it ends up, really!
So, shall I move the files to number_theory in the overview PR, or should I open another easy PR?
I think you can combine them
Synthesis: move it to analytic_number_theory :upside_down:
I went for combining the PRs, rather than analysis and number_theory... :upside_down:
